title: (x) Ash "Orpheus" - Euro Machina {Mark S}
content:
Hello   
Can someone Please ID the Ash CD Cover Font. Both "Ash" and "Orpheus" if possible? Thanks   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/36212.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Lacoste font - (similar to) TheSans {Eduardo}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4872 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Film Festival laurels {Chesh} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4853 "Go to next forum topic")
author: josefinito

comments.content: Nobody?

I wouldn't be surprised if the logo is custom drawn ; as for the   
album title I haven't got a clue (it is quite small BTW, maybe if   
you had a bigger sample we would be able to make more of it).

Here's one   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/36274.jpg)

No, not the logo: the album title. I really think the Ash logo is   
custom drawn.
Biggest I could Find

oh the orpheus you ment sorry. This is the biggest   
 [http://www.noise-online.com/ashcd.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056/http:/www.noise-online.com/ashcd.jpg)
Any Idea
Any Idea?
Any Idea?
C'mon Yves do you know it?
C'mon Yves do you know it?
C'mon Yves do you know it?

Is he doing this on purpose?   
   
Is he doing this on purpose?   
   
Is he doing this on purpose?
I think he has a stutter

No I haven't got any idea, sorry.   
   
No I haven't got any idea, sorry.   
   
No I haven't got any idea, sorry.   
   
If I knew I would've told you Joseph.   
   
If I knew I would've told you Joseph.   
   
If I knew I would've told you Joseph.
Forgive me Yves and Patricia, wasnt my intention the three "any ideas" werent my fault i tried to edit the first one and came two more sorry Yves

Don't worry we're just having a laff. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif) Let's hope somebody   
recognizes this one.

Found it: [Euro Machina](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/euromachina-bt/euro-machina-bt/testdrive.html?s=ORPHEUS&p=48). It's funny, I looked at this and thought it might be one of Brian's.
and unfortunately, we were NO HELP AT ALL to Joseph. Apogee has a similar look to the Orpheus font but not the same.
Thanx guys you were help, Unfortunaly Euro Machina isnt free and I cant afford it right now.
Thanx guys you were help, Unfortunaly Euro Machina isnt free and I cant afford it right now.
Boy-o-boy, this thread provided laughs on several levels, with Joseph providing the punch line

I think for once I'm not going to remove the double and   
triple-posts on this one. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071111143056im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif) Mark you are a gem.
Thanks. The pressure is just too much to bear sometimes. It was all I could do just to make the i.d.

Arghh Thanks I thought this forum was different. I have convinced myself that the best forum is Dafont. And Thanks alot again, Thank you!!! I miss-spell because Im not from the US nor the UK. Im from Mexico Thanks for laughing. Thank you.... Everyone except Mark that really tried to help me. KCUF UOY LLA!

Okay everyone, I think we have to be a little more careful   
with first-time "customers" to not give the impression we are   
laughing at them. Our style of humor is sometimes a bit   
dense and might be mistaken for mockery, as Joseph's last   
post seems to indicate. I'm not casting any stones here   
because I neglected to insert the appropriate smileys myself.   
   
Dear Joseph, I'm serious now: I profusely apologize if   
we might've given the impression we were making fun   
of you, which was certainly not our intention, nor was   
it to hurt your feelings. I hope you'll forgive us and give   
the Typophile Type Identification Board another chance.
OK... I will give the TTIB another chance
